ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: i learned how to speak more spanish and think critically in a different language

This course not only strengthened my Spanish skills, but expanded my cultural knowledge. I received insights on cultures of Latin American countries + Spain as well as the cultures of other students in the class.

This class helped me fill in a lot of gaps in my knowledge of Spanish. I feel a lot more comfortable speaking, presenting, writing, and listening. I also have a better grasp on vocabulary and grammar. Overall, it was a really great language class.
I have been able to gain a better comprehension of Spanish grammar from taking this course, as well as improved my speaking using correct grammar.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: defintely should do more grammar lessons in class instead of leaving them all up to vhl then assessing them on the test but other than that it was a good course and the seminar class size made it a lot better than expected

The strength of this course was its curriculum. It was well planned and covered a wide range of topics. The weakness was the shortness of each class meeting. It was difficult to accomplish the entirety of our lessons in such a brief period of time.

My teacher did a great job engaging students through lectures, activities, and presentations. The lessons were relatively easy to understand, and I felt that there was a emphasis on cultural learning, which made the language much more interesting for me. Sometimes there was a lot of work, but it was manageable.

Strengths would be how chill the class would be. It was fun to talk with your classmates in Spanish and the activities done were interactive, allowing all of us to talk to everyone in the class. The presentations and the lingua meetings were also great ways to practice speaking Spanish as well. Announcements for assignments were given by the professor too, making it easier to remember. Weaknesses were little other than the professor may have been a little bit difficult to understand at times when teaching a concept.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes - Maria is a great instructor. Class is very interactive, and my speaking skills have improved immensely because of normal days in class as well as weekly presentations.
Yes, I would recommend this course to another student because it was a wonderful introduction to Spanish language and culture. Mara, the professor, was an absolute joy to learn from.

I absolutely would! This class is great, and I learned a lot more than I expected. The size of the classes is also really conducive to learning, and my teacher was helpful and excited to teach. It might be more difficult, depending on your knowledge, but overall I think the class is structured well.

I would recommend this class to another course because it is a class where you are learning Spanish in a fun way. This class will not be a bad one in my opinion and the resources are there to help if anything.
